intro: Gastrolychnis soczaviana subsp. ogilviensis, commonly known as the Ogilvie's nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and oval, dark green leaves with a slightly waxy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, typically blooming in late summer. Its fruits are berries that mature to a deep red or black color, containing several seeds. This subspecies is native to specific regions in southern Africa and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
